attributes.action: Make it law that a change in leadership of a currently governing political party, forces a general election
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Prime Minister,

With the recent news that you intend to stand down as the leader of the Labour party, I find the idea that a party can re-elect a new prime minister rather strange.

When people vote in a general election they vote not just for their local MP but also for the leader of the party itself.

If this leader changes then the vote should not be considered correct and a general election should be triggered within a short time period.

The general voting public may not agree with the choice of new Prime Minister and wish to change their vote.

Thank you

Mark Curtlin

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
